Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Rev. David K. Brawley, Pastor, St. Paul Community Baptist Church, 859 Hendrix Street, Brooklyn, N.Y. 11207.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Barron.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Rev. David K. Brawley, Pastor, St. Paul Community Baptist Church, 859 Hendrix Street, Brooklyn, N.Y. 11207.

Council Member Barron moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.  Council Member Williams also joined in to move to spread the Invocation.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of September 23, 2014 be adopted as printed by Council Member Menchaca.
Items.MinutesNote: On behalf of Council Member Menchaha, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of September 23, 2014 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By Council Member Johnson:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council and §20-226 or §20-225 of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 461 West 23rd Street, Borough of Manhattan, Community Board No. 4, Application no.  20155064 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Sidewalk café, 461 West 23rd St, Manhattan (20155064 TCM)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Mealy:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council Rules and Section 197-d (b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Review Procedure (ULURP) application no. C 140360 PSK  be subject to Council review.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Landmarks, 444 Thomas S. Boyland St, Brooklyn (C 140360 PSK)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Arroyo:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council Rules and Section 197-d (b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Review Procedure (ULURP) application no. C 140388 PCX  be subject to Council review.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Landmarks, 850 East 138th St, Bronx (C 140388 PCX)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Mendez:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council and §20-226 or §20-225 of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 311 Second Avenue, Borough of Manhattan, Community Board No. 6, Application no. 20155034 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Sidewalk café, 311 Second Ave, Manhattan (20155034 TCM)

Items.Title: Communication from the Speaker
Discussion of General Orders
Reports of Special Committees
Reports of Standing Committees

Resolution calling upon Congress to pass and the President to sign H.R. 1217 and S. 568 to establish the Smithsonian American Latino Museum and designate the Arts and Industries Building as its future location in Washington, D.C.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.  
Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Establish the Smithsonian American Latino Museum and designate the Arts and Industries Building as its future location in Washington, D.C. (H.R.1217/S.568)

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Education

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of education to report information regarding guidance counselors and social workers in schools.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Requiring the department of education to report information regarding guidance counselors and social workers in schools.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Department of Education to establish a comprehensive college preparation program, based on the college readiness model proposed by the Urban Youth Collaborative, to improve and expand college access for all students.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Education
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.  
Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Establish a comprehensive college preparation program.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Finance
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the establishment of the West Shore business improvement district.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Establishment of the West Shore BID

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Transportation
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring signs regarding penalties for assaulting taxi and livery drivers.

Items.Title: Resolution recognizing October as Domestic Violence Awareness Month in the City of New York.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Women’s Issues
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.  
Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Recognizing October as Domestic Violence Awareness Month in the City of NY.

Items.Title: Resolution approving with modifications the decision of the City Planning Commission on ULURP No. C 140300 ZSM (L.U. No. 115), for the grant of a special permit pursuant to Section 74-712(a) of the Zoning Resolution to modify the use regulations of Section 42-14(D)(2)(b) to allow uses permitted under Section 32-15 (Use Group 6 uses) below the floor level of the second story of a proposed 6-story commercial building on a zoning lot which, as of December 15, 2003, has not more than 20% of its lot area occupied by existing buildings, located at 19 East Houston Street (Block 511, Lot 19), in an M1-5B District, within the SoHo Cast-Iron Historic District, Borough of Manhattan.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: LU 115 - Zoning, 19 East Houston St, SoHo Cast-Iron Historic District, Manhattan (C 140300 ZSM)

Items.Title: Resolution approving with modifications the decision of the City Planning Commission on ULURP No. C 140301 ZSM (L.U. No. 116), for the grant of a special permit pursuant to Section 74-712(b) of the Zoning Resolution to modify the height and setback requirements of Section 43-43 (Maximum Height of Front Wall and Required Front Setbacks)  to facilitate the development of a 6-story commercial building on a zoning lot which, as of December 15, 2003, has not more than 20% of its lot area occupied by existing buildings, located at 19 East Houston Street (Block 511, Lot 19), in an M1-5B District, within the SoHo Cast-Iron Historic District, Borough of Manhattan.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: LU 116 - Zoning, 19 East Houston St, SoHo Cast-Iron Historic District, Manhattan (C 140301 ZSM)

Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: LU 118 - Zoning, 19 East Houston St, Manhattan (C 140299 PPM)

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign S.7738/ A.9979, to change the admissions criteria for New York City’s Specialized High Schools.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Change the admissions criteria for NYC’s Specialized High Schools. (S.7738/ A.9979)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to pass and the President to sign H. Res. 85, which recognizes the importance of acknowledging the contributions of Dominican-Americans to the United States.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Recognizes the importance of acknowledging the contributions of Dominican-Americans to the US. (H.R.85)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Metropolitan Transportation Authority to require that all contractors hired by the Authority are certified by the Society for Protective Coatings in the appropriate standards for lead abatement.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: MTA require that all contractors hired by the Authority are certified by the Society for Protective Coating in the appropriate standards for lead abatement.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Public Service Commission to include language in utility tariffs to prohibit the placement of utility meters in front of residential buildings throughout New York City.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Public Service Commission to include language in utility tariffs to prohibit the placement of utility meters in front of residential buildings throughout NYC.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the Chancellor of the New York City Department of Education to amend Chancellor’s Regulation A-655, regarding mandatory members of School Leadership Teams (SLTs), to include one parent of a child with an Individualized Education Program (IEP).
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Amend Chancellor’s Regulation A-655, regarding mandatory members of School Leadership Teams (SLTs), to include one parent of a child with an Individualized Education Program (IEP).

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign legislation that would create tax credits for women’s health care providers.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Create tax credits for women’s health care providers.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State legislature to pass legislation requiring insurance companies to cover other types of cancer screening testing including genetics testing, ultrasounds and magnetic resonance imaging and mandating that insurance companies dedicate a portion of their profits to researching and developing new early detection screening measures for cancer.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Requiring insurance companies to cover other types of cancer screening testing including genetics testing, ultrasounds and magnetic resonance imaging.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring school buses to operate in bus lanes during hours of operation.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Requiring school buses to operate in bus lanes during hours of operation.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to creating a task force on domestic violence perpetrators.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Women's Issues
Items.MatterName: Creating a task force on domestic violence perpetrators.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation establishing a fixed water rate for people living on a fixed income.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Establishing a fixed water rate for people living on a fixed income.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to including information about candidates for federal, state, and county offices in the New York City voters guide.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Including information about candidates for federal, state, and county offices in the NYC voters guide.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Permissible parking at senior centers.

Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Online facilitation of voter registration.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to the waterfront management advisory board, and to repeal section 1303 of such charter in relation thereto
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Waterfronts
Items.MatterName: Waterfront management advisory board.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Department of Education to mandate school uniforms.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Dept of Education to mandate school uniforms.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the prior notification of tree planting abutting private residential property.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Parks and Recreation
Items.MatterName: Prior notification of tree planting abutting private residential property.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the City of New York, in relation to criminally negligent infliction of physical injury.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Criminally negligent infliction of physical injury.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of education to report annually on student demographics in community school districts and high schools.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Requiring the department of education to report annually on student demographics in community school districts and high schools.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to drug and alcohol testing of taxi and limousine commission licensed drivers.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Drug and alcohol testing of taxi and limousine commission licensed drivers.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to permitting the appeal of decisions by the board of standards and appeals to the city council.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Permitting the appeal of decisions by the board of standards and appeals to the city council.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to expiration of variances granted by the board of standards and appeals
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Expiration of variances granted by the board of standards and appeals.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the disposal of mattresses and box springs.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Disposal of mattresses and box springs.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing a pilot program for issuing warning notifications for first-time offenders of certain litter laws.

Items.MatterName: Establishing a pilot program for issuing warning notifications for first-time offenders of certain litter laws.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring secondhand automobile dealers to disclose whether automobiles have been recalled by the automobiles’ manufacturers
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Requiring secondhand automobile dealers to disclose whether automobiles have been recalled by the automobiles’ manufacturers.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Housing Authority to establish an admission preference for applicants with severe health conditions.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Housing
Items.MatterName: NYCHA to establish an admission preference for applicants with severe health conditions.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Department of Education to officially recognize the importance and benefits of school diversity and to set it as a priority when making decisions regarding admissions policies and practices, creation of new schools, school rezoning and other pertinent decisions and commit to having a strategy in each district for overcoming impediments to school diversity.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: DOE to officially recognize the importance and benefits of school diversity.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Recovery and Resiliency
Items.MatterName: Distribution of localized emergency preparedness materials.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Contracts
Items.MatterName: Contracts of the department of design and construction.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to requiring that the meetings of local authorities and entities subject to section two hundred sixty-a of the state education law within the city of New York be webcast.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Technology
Items.MatterName: Requiring that the meetings of local authorities and entities subject to section 260-a of the state education law within the city of NY be webcast.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to the investigating, reviewing, studying, and auditing of and making of recommendations relating to the operations, budget, and staffing of the New York Public Library, the Brooklyn Public Library and the Queens Public Library by the commissioner of investigation.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring multiple dwelling owners to provide notice to their tenants prior to temporarily or permanently making building amenities unavailable.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to pass and the President to sign H.R. 5277/S.2695, also known as the Survivor Outreach and Support Campus Act, which would amend the Higher Education Act of 1965 to require institutions of higher education to have an independent advocate for campus sexual assault prevention and response.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Higher Education
Items.MatterName: Survivor Outreach and Support Campus Act (H.R. 5277/S.2695)

Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: DOE establish an awareness and prevention program in the public schools athletic league to combat intimate partner abuse.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to mandate that the New York State Education Department include intimate partner abuse awareness and prevention programs in all public middle school and high school athletic programs.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Mandate that the NYS Education Dept include intimate partner abuse awareness and prevention programs in all public middle school and high school athletic programs.

Items.Title: Application no. C 140300 ZSM submitted by MC 19 East Houston, LLC, pursuant to Sections 197-c and 201 of the New York City Charter for the grant of a special permit pursuant to Section 74-712(a) of the Zoning Resolution to modify the use regulations of Section 42-14(D)(2)(b) to allow uses permitted under Section 32-15 (Use Group 6 uses) below the floor level of the second story of a proposed 6-story commercial building on a zoning lot which, as of December 15, 2003, has not more than 20% of its lot area occupied by existing buildings, located at 19 East Houston Street (Block 511, Lot 19), in an M1-5B District, within the SoHo Cast-Iron Historic District. MICHAEL M. McSWEENEY, City Clerk

C 140301 ZSM submitted by MC 19 East Houston, LLC, pursuant to Sections 197-c and 201 of the New York City Charter for the grant of a special permit pursuant to Section 74-712(b) of the Zoning Resolution to modify the height and setback requirements of Section 43-43 (Maximum Height of Front Wall and Required Front Setbacks)  to facilitate the development of a 6-story commercial building on a zoning lot which, as of December 15, 2003, has not more than 20% of its lot area occupied by existing buildings, located at 19 East Houston Street (Block 511, Lot 19), in an M1-5B District, within the SoHo Cast-Iron Historic District, Borough of Manhattan, Community Board 2, Council District 1.  This application is subject to the review and action by the Land Use Committee only if appealed to the Council pursuant to 197-d(b)(2) of the Charter or called up by a vote of the Council pursuant to 197-d(b)(3) of the Charter.
